title: Former Temple linebacker commits to Virginia Tech
body_text:
COLLEGE FOOTBALL
Former Temple LB headed to Hokies
Virginia Tech gained a commitment from former Temple linebacker Antwone Santiago, a 6-foot-3, 225-pounder from Meriden, Connecticut. He made 25 tackles for the Owls last season and has two years of eligibility remaining.
Former James Madison wide receiver Yamir Knight committed to SMU, his agency QCSports said. He had 53 catches for 605 yards and four touchdowns for the Dukes in 2024.
COLLEGE MEN’S BASKETBALL
NSU gains transfer, JUCO standout
Norfolk State signed Devon Ellis, a 6-foot-7 forward who averaged 4.8 points, 2.6 rebounds and 12.2 minutes per game last season for Valparaiso. He averaged 11.6 points and 4.4 rebounds in 2023-24 as a Maryland Eastern Shore freshman.
The Spartans also signed 6-9 forward Yel Deeng from Amarillo, Texas. Averaging 10 points, 5.1 rebounds and 0.9 blocks per game for Casper College (25-7) last season, the sophomore is ranked as the No. 80 JUCO player in the 2025 class by JucoRecruiting.com.
COLLEGE WOMEN’S LACROSSE
JMU, USF to play for title at ODU
Top-seeded James Madison will face second-seeded South Florida at noon Saturday at Old Dominion’s L.R. Hill Sports Complex for the American Athletic Conference Tournament championship. The victor will gain an automatic bid to the NCAA tourney.
After JMU beat Vanderbilt 16-6 Friday, USF (13-4) — a team in its first year of Division I varsity competition — ousted East Carolina 14-12 in the second semifinal. The Bulls’ Bailey Morris scored twice in the final 2:24 to eliminate the Pirates (7-10), who got five goals from Erin Gulden.
COLLEGE SOFTBALL
UNCW again fends off Hampton
UNC Wilmington (27-22, 13-13 Coastal Athletic Association) beat Hampton for the second time in as many days, winning 5-3 as Cassidy Relay was 2 for 3 and scored twice.
Kylie Hill’s two-run homer in the second and Carmynn Bonner’s bases-loaded walk brought in runs for HU (15-33, 5-21).
Thursday, UNCW edged HU 2-1 in 10 innings despite effective pitching for four innings by Leah Maduro and for 5 1/3 by Angelina Branch (8-10). Madison Biddle walked to start the bottom of the 10th, went to third on Morgan Britt’s bunt single and scored on Allison Corbin’s sacrifice fly to center.
Hampton went ahead in the first off Mikayla Huddleston, who pitched the first nine innings. Kylee Quinn was hit by a pitch, went to second on a passed ball and scored on Hill’s single up the middle. The Seahawks pulled even in the fifth on two singles, a sacrifice bunt and Biddle’s sacrifice fly.
BSC splits two tournament games
Bryant & Stratton went 1-1 in its first two games of the National Junior College Athletic Association Region 10 Division II tourney in Marion, North Carolina.
Thursday, the Bobcats (34-11) lost 4-1 to Cleveland Community College. Friday, the Bobcats shut out Wake Technical CC 9-0 in five innings in an elimination game.
COLLEGE WOMEN’S BASKETBALL
Former Northwestern guard to join Hokies
Virginia Tech and coach Megan Duffy added a commitment from 5-11 former Northwestern guard Melannie Daley this morning, per her Instagram.
From Hastings, New York, she averaged 11.7 points, 3.3 rebounds and 2.7 assists per game last season. She has one year of eligibility remaining.
PRO BASKETBALL
Shulga, Duke players invited to NBA Draft Combine
Former VCU star Max Shulga, Florida State’s Jamir Watkins (a VCU transfer) and Duke’s Cooper Flagg, Isaiah Evans, Sion James, Kon Knueppel and Khaman Maluach were among 75 players invited to the NBA Draft Combine. It will be held May 11-18 in Chicago.
HIGH SCHOOL BASKETBALL
Iverson Classic set for Hampton Coliseum
At 7 Saturday night at Hampton Coliseum, the annual Allen Iverson Classic All-American Game is set to feature players such as Tennessee-committed Nate Ament, Kansas signee Darryn Peterson, South Carolina-committed Eli Ellis and Syracuse signee Kiyan Anthony. Anthony is the son of Carmelo Anthony.
